messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 50 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Memristor-Based Selective Convolutional Circuit for High-Density Salt-and-Pepper Noise Removal

Paper Abstract: Abstract In this article, we propose a memristor-based selective convolutional (MSC) circuit for salt-and-pepper (SAP) noise removal. We implement its algorithm using memristors in analog circuits. In experiments, we build the MSC model and benchmark it against a ternary selective convolutional (TSC) model. Results show that the MSC model effectively restores images corrupted by SAP noise, achieving similar performance to the TSC model in both quantitative measures and visual quality at noise densities of up to 50%. Note that at high noise densities, the performance of the MSC model even surpasses the theoretical benchmark of its corresponding TSC model. In addition, we propose an enhanced MSC (MSCE) model based on MSC, which reduces power consumption by 57.6% compared with the MSC model while improving performance.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 50 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 50"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "A fast nonlocally centralized sparse representation algorithm for image denoising",
        "A decomposition framework for image denoising algorithms",
        "Computation on stochastic bit streams digital image processing case studies",
        "0.5-v dtmos median filter",
        "Modified adaptive median filtering",
        "Adaptive median filters: new algorithms and results",
        "An improved recursive and adaptive median filter for high density impulse noise",
        "Different applied median filter in salt and pepper noise",
        "Approximate arithmetic for low-power image median filtering",
        "Different adaptive modified riesz mean filter for high-density salt-and-pepper noise removal in grayscale images",
        "A new adaptive weighted mean filter for removing salt-and-pepper noise",
        "Adaptive switching weight mean filter for salt and pepper image denoising",
        "Improved adaptive weighted mean filter for salt-and-pepper noise removal",
        "Adaptive ces√°ro mean filter for salt-and-pepper noise removal",
        "An adaptive decision based kriging interpolation algorithm for the removal of high density salt and pepper noise in images",
        "Low-voltage low-power bulk-driven analog median filter",
        "A modified inexact arithmetic median filter for removing salt-and-pepper noise from gray-level images",
        "Evolutionary functional approximation of circuits implemented into fpgas",
        "Analog circuit implementation based on median filter for salt and pepper noise reduction in image",
        "Residual dense network for image super-resolution",
        "Plug-and-play image restoration with deep denoiser prior",
        "Deep graph-convolutional image denoising",
        "Ffdnet: Toward a fast and flexible solution for cnn-based image denoising",
        "Beyond a gaussian denoiser: Residual learning of deep cnn for image denoising",
        "Salt and pepper noise removal with image inpainting",
        "Deep cnn for removal of salt and pepper noise",
        "A very fast and efficient multistage selective convolution filter for removal of salt and pepper noise",
        "A deep convolutional neural network for salt-and-pepper noise removal using selective convolutional blocks",
        "Realizing spike-timing dependent plasticity learning rule in pt/cu: Zno/nb: Sto memristors for implementing single spike based denoising autoencoder",
        "A memristor-based quaternary memory with adaptive noise tolerance",
        "Convolution kernel operations on a two-dimensional spin memristor cross array",
        "Srmc: A multibit memristor crossbar for self-renewing image mask",
        "Memristor-based neuromorphic chips",
        "Efficient training algorithms for neural networks based on memristive crossbar circuits",
        "Neuromemristive circuits for edge computing: A review",
        "Pattern classification by memristive crossbar circuits using ex situ and in situ training",
        "Enabling back propagation training of memristor crossbar neuromorphic processors",
        "Memristor-based multilayer neural networks with online gradient descent training",
        "Edge learning using a fully integrated neuro-inspired memristor chip",
        "Deep learning based switching filter for impulsive noise removal in color images",
        "An iterative mean filter for image denoising",
        "Hardware implementation of memristor-based artificial neural networks",
        "Ternary weight networks",
        "Spice model of memristive devices with threshold",
        "Memristor-based edge computing of shufflenetv2 for image classification",
        "Memristor-based edge computing of blaze block for image recognition",
        "Highly parallelized memristive binary neural network",
        "Memristive fully convolutional network: An accurate hardware image-segmentor in deep learning",
        "Memristor-based design of sparse compact convolutional neural network",
        "A database of human segmented natural images and its application to evaluating segmentation algorithms and measuring ecological statistics"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 50 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Memristor-Based Selective Convolutional Circuit for High-Density Salt-and-Pepper Noise Removal, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
